title: Health & Wellness Seminar - “Your Best Foot Forward”
description: The seminar “Putting Your Best Foot Forward” offers a comprehensive exploration of foot and ankle health, focusing on the critical role of proper footwear and accessories in preventing and managing injuries, particularly for runners. Big Peach Running Co. - Braseton has partnered with Peachtree Orthopedics to host this event. Attendees will gain insights into the importance of quality, well-fitted shoes and the specialized designs behind them, tailored to support foot and ankle health. Dr. Conor Murphy, a fellowship trained Orthopedic Foot & Ankle surgeon, will discuss common running injuries, their causes, and how custom orthotics, inserts, socks, and other durable medical equipment can address specific foot and ankle pathologies. Experts from Big Peach - Braselton will also highlight the benefits of a professional shoe fit process, ensuring participants leave equipped with practical knowledge to optimize their footwear choices and enhance overall mobility and comfort. Ryan Kyranakis If you would like to attend on zoom, please register via the registration button. An email will be sent prior to the seminar with a zoom link. 230 E.E. Butler Parkway Gainesville, GA 30501 | Phone: (7

description: Interactive Neighborhood for Kids Thursday, January 8 8:30 - 9:30 AM 3900 INK Ave Oakwood, GA 30566 Join us for an opportunity to hear from Charlie Bramwell, Director, along with Associate Directors Jenny Staley and Cortney Murray of Interactive Neighborhood for Kids (INK). They’ll share exciting updates about their brand-new, state-of-the-art facility and innovative programs designed to inspire and engage young minds. Don’t miss the chance to take a guided tour of the new space and see firsthand how INK is creating impactful learning experiences for children and families. title: Marketing Workshop 2026
description: Marketing Workshop 2026 Wednesday, January 21, 2026 8:30 - 10:30 AM Brenau Downtown Center 301 Main Street, Gainesville, GA Finding Your Voice: How Brands Stay Authentic in an AI World When artificial intelligence can generate content, automate campaigns, and predict consumer behavior, what keeps your brand truly unique? The team at Forum Communications will discuss how organizations can maintain a consistent, authentic brand presence in an AI-driven environment. They’ll discuss the intersection of storytelling, digital and traditional marketing tactics, and the importance of building a voice that is unmistakably human, no matter the platform or technology. Attendees will walk away with practical insights on balancing automation with authenticity, using AI in efficient and practical ways, and ensuring their brand stands out as real, relatable, and relevant in an ever-crowded (and noisy) marketplace. $25 Member $40 Non-Member 230 E.E. Butler Parkway Gainesville, GA 30501 | Phone: (770) 532-6206

title: Firearm Safety Class
description: Firearm Safety Class Retired Major Ramsey with the Lumpkin County Sheriff's Office will be teaching the Firearm Safety Course from 6-9 pm at the Lumpkin County Sheriff's Office. The course is offered at no cost for the following: 1) residents of Lumpkin County 18 years and older or 2) a student that attends school in Lumpkin County (18 years and older) or 3) works in Lumpkin County. title: Health & Wellness Seminar - Why Everyone Should Care about Hospice & The region's first Hospice House
description: Hospice of Northeast Georgia Medical Center (NGMC) is changing the way our community understands end-of-life care — from home-based hospice to the region’s first freestanding Hospice House, now under construction in Gainesville. As a Level 5 We Honor Veterans Partner and recipient of the Hospice Honors Elite award (placing it among the nation’s top 5% of hospices), Hospice of NGMC is built on a promise: compassionate, patient-centered care for everyone, regardless of ability to pay. In this presentation, Dr. Mary Keith will explain what hospice and palliative care truly mean, why these services matter long before the final days, and how NGMC’s expanding programs — including the upcoming Hospice House — offer peace, comfort and connection for patients and families. If you would like to attend on zoom, please register via the registration button. An email will be sent prior to the seminar with a zoom link. 230 E.E. Butler Parkway Gainesville, GA 30501 | Phone: (770) 532-6206

title: Arbor Day
description: The community’s Annual Arbor Day Celebration is Friday, February 20 at 10 a.m. at Elachee Nature Science Center . Open to the public, the event is coordinated by the Greater Hall Chamber of Commerce and sponsored by the Hall County Master Gardeners , Keep Hall Beautiful and Georgia Power . Festivities include student contest recognition and a joint City of Gainesville/Hall County proclamation with Tree City USA recognition. The Greater Hall Chamber of Commerce Beautification Committee and the Georgia Forestry Service will recognize winners of the 2026 Arbor Day Student Art and Essay Contest. Dozens of student art and essay entries were submitted with the topic “I Speak for the Trees.” For information on Arbor Day or other Greater Hall Chamber Community Development programs, including Agribusiness programs and Business & Residential Beautification Awards, contact Robin Halstead, Greater Hall Chamber of Commerce, 770-532-6206 x 101. Email: rhalstead@ghcc.com 230 E.E. Butler Parkway Gainesville, GA 30501 | Phone: (770) 532-6206

title: Business Showcase 2026
description: Business Showcase Tuesday, February 24, 2026 2:00 - 5:00 PM Gainesville Civic Center *SPACE IS LIMITED-- if you're interested in exhibiting, please email ecardin@ghcc.com* Registration for the Showcase Social is STILL OPEN! Discover the heartbeat of our local economy at the Business Showcase , where businesses from across the region come together to highlight their products, services, and innovations. Whether you're a fellow business owner, a professional looking to expand your network, or a curious community member, this event is your chance to engage directly with local businesses and entrepreneurs. Browse booths, make connections, and see what makes our local business community thrive. Then stick around for the Showcase Social from 5–7 PM to keep the conversations going over food, drinks, and good company! Please Note: All booths that remain set up throughout Showcase Social will be entered to win a full refund for their booth Chamber Member Exhibit $350 Non-Member Exhibit $550 A ttendance is FREE and OPEN TO THE PUBLIC Showcase Social Tuesday, February 24, 2026 5:00 - 7:00 PM Gainesville Civic Center REGISTER HERE Stick around (or join us!) for the Showcase Social —an evening o

title: Small Business Seminar - How The UGA Small Business Development Center Can Help You Thrive in 2026!
description: Tuesday, March 10th Networking 8:15 - 8:30 AM Seminar 8:30 - 9:30 AM Join Tom Jones and Stephanie Sokenis to find out about the tools and resources available through your local UGA SBDC office to help you tackle the biggest challenges in your mature or startup business. One of the best small business resources you may not know about, the SBDC offers no-cost one-on-one consulting and a variety of training opportunities that support informed decision-making and long-term growth. During this session, attendees will learn how a business can use the SBDC to: Work one-on-one with a consultant at no cost to identify challenges, clarify goals, and plan next steps Use strategic planning to support decisions, growth initiatives, and operational improvements Analyze P&L, cash flow or capital acquisition opportunities Implement effective marketing strategies, digital marketing initiatives, and market research Enhance operations and efficiency, including systems, processes, and staffing considerations Powered in part by the U.S. Small Business Administration, the University of Georgia Small Business Development Center combines no-cost consultations and a variety of training workshops and classe

description: Join us for networking with beautiful lake views. Lanier Canoe & Kayak Club located at 3105 Clarks Bridge Rd., Gainesville, GA. Parking is free and we suggest everyone park in the Lanier Olympic park on the side of the blue building…. Enter through the black gate. Come enjoy the beautiful lake views and network with us! title: South Hall Business Coalition - King's Hawaiian
description: King's Hawaiian Thursday, April 21 9:00 - 10:00 AM 5425 Aloha Way Flowery Branch, GA 30542 Join us for an update and tour of the King's Hawaiian Bakery in South Hall County, where their flagship product, Hawaiian sweet bread, is produced. Tour attendees will see a state-of-the-art facility and learn what it takes to produce the irresistible sweet rolls from start to finish. Founded in 1955, the company has grown from a small bakery operation in Hawaii, to a distribution company selling bread, rolls, and pretzels bites nationwide. The family-owned food company expanded its Oakwood facility, creating more than 160 new jobs. This new 150,000-square-foot bakery is located across the street from the King's Hawaiian facility in Oakwood South Industrial Park. King's Hawaiian opened in Oakwood in 2010, and today provides over 800 jobs for the Hall County community. **Please note: space is LIMITED. Max 3 people per organization** REGISTER HERE $8.00 Member $15.00 Non-Member Light breakfast included 230 E.E. Butler Parkway Gainesville, GA 30501 | Phone: (770) 532-6206
